description: Democrat and Republican lawmakers have condemned President Vladimir Putin for the death of Alexei Navalny, Russia's most prominent opposition figure.
title: U.S. lawmakers pay tribute to Navalny, blame Putin for his death

description: Yulia Navalnaya received a standing ovation as she addressed the Munich Security Conference, shortly after hearing the news of her husband’s death in a Russian prison camp.
title: Alexei Navalany’s wife calls for defeat of Putin’s ‘horrific regime’

description: Zimbabwe’s powerful vice president said the government will block a university scholarship for young LGBTQ+ people, a move that human rights groups described Friday as a perpetuation of the African country’s homophobic practices.
title: Zimbabwe’s vice president says the government will block a scholarship for LGBTQ people

description: President Joe Biden said we still don't know "exactly what happened" to cause Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny's death, but "Putin and his thugs" are responsible.
title: Biden: 'No doubt' Putin is responsible for Navalny's death

description: A decadelong dispute between the Mexican soccer federation and FIFA over multiple fines for fans chanting anti-gay slurs at games went to sport’s highest court on Thursday.
title: Mexico and FIFA go back to sports court in decadelong dispute over soccer fans' gay slurs

description: Global leaders and senior officials have been swift to condemn the death in a penal colony of Alexei Navalny, Russia’s most prominent opposition figure.
title: Russian opposition leader's death prompts global outrage, with many blaming Putin

description: Indian farmers demanding higher prices for their crops said they had paused their protest march to New Delhi on Friday until their unions hold another round of talks with government ministers on Sunday.
title: Indian farmers pause protest march to Delhi as government talks continue

description: The U.S. military has carried out a cyberattack on a suspected Iranian military vessel with the goal of preventing the vessel from collecting targeting information that could of been passed on to Houthi rebels. NBC News' Courtney Kube reports on this exclusive report in the latest tensions between the U.S. and Iran.
title: U.S. carries out cyberattack on suspected Iranian spy ship

description: Organizers of the Hugo Awards for science fiction excluded multiple authors from shortlists last year over concerns about offending China, leaked emails show.
title: Science fiction authors were excluded from awards for fear of offending China

description: Prince Harry has revealed that his father, King Charles III of Britain, is xxx following his cancer diagnosis earlier this month, in a new interview.
title: Prince Harry says he has considered becoming an American citizen

description: According to the Russian Prison Service, Alexei Navalny was taking a walk when he felt unwell, quickly lost consciousness and prison medical staff were unable to revive him. NBC News’ Richard Engel reports on Navalny’s inner circle casting doubt on the description of events leading to Navalny’s reported death.
title: Navalny dies in Siberian gulag known as 'the polar wolf'

description: Video from Feb. 15 showed Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny making a remote appearance from Kharp at a court in Kovrov, Russia. Navalny appeared to joke with the judge, asking him to send money from his "huge federal" salary. Russia's penitentiary service said that Navalny had "felt unwell" after a walk on Friday and "almost immediately lost consciousness." Medical staff were unable to resuscitate him.
title: WATCH: Navalny appears in court the day before he died

description: Paul McCartney has been reunited with the iconic bass guitar that became a key part of the Fab Four's image during their rise to fame in the 1960s.
title: Paul McCartney reunited with famous bass stolen 50 years ago after online campaign

description: Egypt appears to be building a wall and is levelling land near its border with the Gaza Strip ahead of an anticipated Israeli offensive targeting the border city of Rafah.
title: Video and satellite photos appear to show new Egyptian construction near the Gaza border

description: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny has died in prison, the country's state media reported Friday, ending a yearslong fight against corruption and the Kremlin that saw him survive several poisoning attempts.
title: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny dies in prison

description: Voters in two districts in England delivered new blows to beleaguered Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, electing opposition-party lawmakers in seats that Sunak’s Conservatives had held for years.
title: U.K. voters deliver double blow to beleaguered Rishi Sunak

description: At least four patients at the Nasser Hospital in Khan Younis have died from a lack of oxygen after a complete power outage followed an Israeli military raid, the Hamas-run health ministry in Gaza said. NBC News' Claudio Lavanga reports for Early Today.
title: 4 patients die at Nasser Hospital after power outage, Gaza health ministry says

description: Greece became the first Orthodox Christian country to legalize same-sex civil marriage. A cross-party majority of 176 lawmakers in the 300-seat parliament voted late Thursday in favor of the bill
title: Landmark legislation as Greece legalizes same-sex marriage

description: Israeli Defense Forces stormed through Nasser Hospital in southern Gaza today, mounting the raid in a search for Hamas operatives and the bodies of Israeli hostages. Hospital staff tried to guide patients to safety as a witness said a ceiling collapsed from an Israeli strike. NBC News’ Raf Sanchez reports.
title: Israeli forces raid Gaza's largest functioning hospital

description: According to a White House official, Russia is making progress toward developing a nuclear-fueled space asset that could block communications and other signals here on Earth. Meanwhile, Russian President Vladimir Putin has said he would prefer President Biden win the election over Republican frontrunner Donald Trump. NBC News’ Peter Alexander reports.
title: U.S. officials are monitoring new Russian satellite threat
